availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Waggoner Shriver (Ohio County, West Virginia, pork packer and insurance agent)

body.p: Ohio County, West Virginia, pork packer and insurance agent. Maryland native. Married to Caroline Zane Shriver. Father of Hampden Z. Shriver, Marion Shriver, William Shriver, James Shriver, and Cornelia Shriver. Pork packer in Ohio County, Virginia, in 1850. Insurance agent in Ohio County in 1860. Employed Margaret Curry as a domestic servant in Ohio County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Ohio County, District 44, p. 103 A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Virginia, Ohio County, Wheeling, Ward 2, p. 154.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Virginia, Ohio County, Wheeling Ward 2, p. 173 B.
_James Shriver (1840-1924), O’Brien County. Grave Registration Service, Cemetery Records for the State of Iowa, 1800-2000. Adjutant General’s Office, Des Moine, Iowa.
"William Waggoner Shriver (1808-1880)," Find A Grave, Memorial #34882833, accessed July 22, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/34882833.
